value.title: The UK ordered 400,000 gowns from Turkey to address its PPE crisis. They didn't meet safety standards
value.excerpt: A high-profile shipment to the UK of 400,000 surgical gowns, hailed by ministers as a solution to Britain's personal protective equipment (PPE) shortages, has ended in catastrophe -- with every one of the garments deemed unusable after arriving from Turkey.

value.title: Iowa sees 12 new COVID-19 deaths, nearly 300 new cases
value.excerpt: Iowa state health officials said Wednesday the state has seen 12 new COVID-19 deaths from the previous day, bringing the state's total to 219. The Iowa Department of Public Health also announced another one-day jump in confirmed cases of the new coronavirus by 293 from Tuesday to Wednesday.

value.title: Scenic Roads in Colorado Remain Closed Amid Coronavirus
value.excerpt: The Colorado Department of Transportation has announced the highway over Independence Pass near Aspen will remain closed until at least June 1 amid the coronavirus pandemic, and the road to the top of Mount Evans west of Denver won’t open until at least the beginning of July.

value.title: Rural Texas hospital struggles to stay open amid coronavirus pandemic
